definitions.definition: Government by bureaus or their administrators or officers .
A system of administration based upon organisation into bureaus , division of labour , a hierarchy of authority , etc., designed to dispose of a large body of work in a routine manner .
examples: At that time the administration replaced the system of patronage in the civil service with a bureaucracy .

definitions.definition: The body of officers and administrators , especially of a government .
examples: The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding bureaucracy . ( apocryphal quip )

definitions.definition: Excessive red tape and routine in any administration , body or behaviour .
examples: The head of the civil service promised to clamp down on bureaucracy .

main_definition: Government by bureaus or their administrators or officers .
secondary_definitions: ( business , organizational theory ) A system of administration based upon organisation into bureaus , division of labour , a hierarchy of authority , etc., designed to dispose of a large body of work in a routine manner .
The body of officers and administrators , especially of a government .
( chiefly derogatory ) Excessive red tape and routine in any administration , body or behaviour .
